inference:
The perimeter of the first figure is $2\times5+2\times2=14$ units.

The perimeter of the second figure is $2\times5+2\times3=16$ units.

The positive difference of the perimeters is $16-14=\boxed{2}.$

ground_truth: The first figure has a perimeter of 18 and the second a perimeter of 14, so the difference is $18-14=\boxed{4}$.
